articles.title: Sudan RSF Drone Strike Kills 75 at Displacement Camp
articles.summary: A paramilitary **RSF drone strike** hit a mosque at a **Darfur** displacement camp Friday, killing **75 people**, according to aid groups. The attack highlights the escalating **Sudan civil war** as the UN warns of worsening humanitarian conditions across the region.

articles.title: Mass Strikes and Protests Challenge Macron's Government in France
articles.summary: Nationwide **strikes and protests** erupted across **France** Thursday, challenging President **Macron** and his new prime minister over the national budget. Unions organized the disruption, voicing complaints that **eight years** of business-friendly policies have benefited too few while hurting many citizens.

articles.title: Massive 7.8 Earthquake Strikes Russia's Pacific Coast Region
articles.summary: A magnitude **7.8 earthquake** struck the **Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky** region near **Russia's coast** Thursday, the U.S. Geological Survey reported. The powerful quake prompted **tsunami advisories** for parts of **Alaska**, particularly the Aleutian Islands, though these were later canceled by authorities.

articles.title: Nvidia Invests Five Billion Dollars in Struggling Intel Corporation
articles.summary: **Nvidia** announced Thursday it will invest **$5 billion** in **Intel**, becoming one of its largest shareholders with roughly **4% ownership**. The investment comes weeks after the White House engineered a federal government stake, representing new hope for Intel's turnaround efforts.

articles.title: Crypto Market Reaches Four Trillion After Fed Rate Cut
articles.summary: The **cryptocurrency market** hit **$4 trillion** valuation after the **Federal Reserve** cut interest rates for the first time in 2025. Within **24 hours**, institutional investors poured hundreds of millions into crypto funds, completely reversing their initial panic selling.

articles.title: Huawei Unveils World's Most Powerful AI Chip Cluster System
articles.summary: **Huawei** announced the world's most powerful **AI chip cluster** as competition with the **United States** intensifies. The Chinese tech giant's breakthrough represents a significant advancement in artificial intelligence infrastructure, challenging American dominance in the semiconductor and AI computing sectors globally.

articles.title: Australia's Fossil Fuel Earnings to Drop Fifty Billion Annually
articles.summary: **Australia's** fossil fuel export earnings will fall by **$50 billion annually** by **2035**, according to Treasury modeling. The decline affects both **coal and LNG exports** as the nation pursues a **65% emissions cut**, fundamentally reshaping the Australian economy's revenue structure.

articles.title: RFK Jr's Vaccine Panel Delays MMRV Shots Until Age Four
articles.summary: A federal vaccine advisory panel **ACIP**, stacked by **RFK Jr.**, recommended delaying combined **MMRV immunization** until age **four**. The controversial decision affects measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccinations, with some panel members reportedly unaware of the group's actual responsibilities.

articles.title: Jimmy Kimmel Suspended Following Stephen Colbert Show Cancellation
articles.summary: **Jimmy Kimmel's** suspension confirms widespread suspicions following **Stephen Colbert's** recent show cancellation. The late-night television landscape faces unprecedented upheaval as major networks restructure their programming, affecting two of America's most prominent political comedy hosts in rapid succession.

articles.title: Russia and Venezuela Sign Strategic Partnership Treaty in Caribbean
articles.summary: **Venezuela's parliament** approved a comprehensive strategic partnership treaty with **Russia**, transforming the **Caribbean** into a new geopolitical front. The **10-year agreement**, signed by Presidents **Maduro and Putin** in Moscow, is renewable every five years and challenges Washington's regional influence.

dailyGreeting: Good morning! Massive quakes and market shakes ahead today.

historicalEvents.description: English defeat French at Battle of Poitiers
President James Garfield dies from assassination wounds
First underground nuclear test conducted by United States
